section.title: Predictions: will and won't
section.sectiontitle: We use subject + will + verb to say what we expect to happen. We use it when there is no particular plan or intention.
section.text1: I expect the weather to be very hot in July.
section.text1a: The weather will be very hot in July.
section.text2: I expect it to cost a lot of money.
section.text2a: It'll cost a lot of money.
section.sectiontitle2: We often use will with I think and I don't think.
section.text3a: Do you think France will win? Yes, I do.
section.text4a: I don't think she'll be very happy when she hears.

section.title: Predictions: will and won't
section.sectiontitle: We use subject + won't + verb to make the negative. Won't means will not.
section.sectiontitle2: In the question we use will + subject + verb. We can also use will + subject + have to/be able to + verb.
section.text4a: Will we have to change trains? No, you won't.
